info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 26 at 12:21PM MST until September 26 at 12:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 1245 PM MST.
* At 1221 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 7 miles south of Gold Canyon to near Queen Creek to San Tan Mountain Park, moving northwest at 40 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 159 and 188. US Highway 60 between mile markers 176 and 211. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 142 and 176.
Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Apache Junction, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, East Mesa, Queen Creek, Granite Reef Dam, Gold Camp, Falcon Field Airport, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield, and Usery Mountain Park.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
